outputs.name: results
outputs.description: The daylight factor values from the simulation.

inputs.name: _model
inputs.description:
A Honeybee Model for which Daylight Factor will be simulated.
Note that this model should have grids assigned to it in order
to produce meaningfule results.

inputs.name: grid_filter_
inputs.description:
Text for a grid identifer or a pattern to filter the sensor grids of
the model that are simulated. For instance, first_floor_* will simulate
only the sensor grids that have an identifier that starts with
first_floor_. By default, all grids in the model will be simulated.

inputs.name: sensor_count_
inputs.description:
Integer for the maximum number of sensor grid points per
parallel execution. (Default: 200).

inputs.name: radiance_par_
inputs.description:
Text for the radiance parameters to be used for ray
tracing. (Default: -ab 2 -aa 0.1 -ad 2048 -ar 64).

inputs.name: run_settings_
inputs.description:
Settings from the "HB Recipe Settings" component that specify
how the recipe should be run. This can also be a text string of
recipe settings.

inputs.name: _run
inputs.description: Set to True to run the recipe and get results.

code:
import os

try:
    from honeybee.config import folders as hb_folders
    from honeybee.model import Model
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:
    from lbt_recipes.recipe import Recipe
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import lbt_recipes:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.{{plugin}} import all_required_inputs, recipe_result
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_{{cad}}:\n\t{}'.format(e))


if all_required_inputs(ghenv.Component) and _run:
    # create the recipe and set the input arguments
    recipe = Recipe('daylight_factor')
    recipe.input_value_by_name('model', _model)
    recipe.input_value_by_name('sensor-grid', grid_filter_)
    recipe.input_value_by_name('sensor-count', sensor_count_)
    recipe.input_value_by_name('radiance-parameters', radiance_par_)

    # set the default project folder based on the model name if available
    if isinstance(_model, Model):
        recipe.default_project_folder = os.path.join(
            hb_folders.default_simulation_folder, _model.identifier, 'Radiance')

    # run the recipe
    project_folder = recipe.run(run_settings_, radiance_check=True)

    # load the results
    results = recipe_result(recipe.output_value_by_name('results', project_folder))
